verses.plain: O LORD, thou hast searched me, and known me.

tokens.t: O
, thou hast searched me, and known

verses.plain: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

tokens.t: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

verses.plain: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

tokens.t: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted
all my ways.

verses.plain: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.

tokens.t: For
not a word in my tongue,
, lo, O
, thou knowest it altogether.

verses.plain: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

tokens.t: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

verses.plain: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

tokens.t: knowledge
too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot
unto it.

verses.plain: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

tokens.t: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

verses.plain: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

tokens.t: If I ascend up into heaven, thou
there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou

verses.plain: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

tokens.t: I take the wings of the morning,
dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

verses.plain: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

tokens.t: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

verses.plain: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

tokens.t: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

verses.plain: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

tokens.t: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light
both alike

verses.plain: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

tokens.t: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

verses.plain: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

tokens.t: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully
wonderfully made: marvellous
thy works; and
my soul knoweth right well.

verses.plain: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

tokens.t: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret,
curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

verses.plain: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

tokens.t: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all
were written,
in continuance were fashioned, when
none of them.

verses.plain: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

tokens.t: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

verses.plain: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

tokens.t: I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

verses.plain: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

tokens.t: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

verses.plain: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

tokens.t: For they speak against thee wickedly,
thine enemies take
in vain.

verses.plain: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

tokens.t: Do not I hate them, O
, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

verses.plain: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

tokens.t: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

verses.plain: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

tokens.t: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

verses.plain: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

tokens.t: And see if
wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

footnotes.text: the darkness and…: Heb. as is the darkness, so is the light
which…: or, what days they should be fashioned
wicked…: Heb. way of pain, or, grief
